common_errors.cause: Binary was stripped of symbols (strip command or -s linker flag)
common_errors.solution: Rebuild without stripping. For release builds, keep separate debug symbols file.

common_errors.cause: File is not an object file, library, or executable
common_errors.solution: Verify file type with: file <filename>. nm works on ELF, Mach-O, COFF binaries.
Check filename and path. Use tab completion or ls to verify.

common_errors.cause: Insufficient permissions to read the file
common_errors.solution: Check file permissions. May need sudo for system binaries.

common_errors.cause: Binary format doesn't match expected target architecture
common_errors.solution: Use -t option to specify target or use appropriate cross-platform nm (e.g., aarch64-linux-gnu-nm)

common_errors.cause: Static library (.a) lacks symbol index for fast lookup
common_errors.solution: Run ranlib on the archive: ranlib libfoo.a

common_errors.cause: Archive file is corrupted or truncated
common_errors.solution: Rebuild the archive. Verify source files are intact.

common_errors.cause: Symbol is declared but not defined (external reference)
common_errors.solution: This is informational - 'U' type symbols are undefined/external. Link with library providing symbol.

common_errors.cause: Binary File Descriptor library encountered unexpected format
common_errors.solution: File may be corrupted. Try objdump -h to check sections. Rebuild binary.

common_errors.cause: nm needs temp space for large files but /tmp is full or not writable
common_errors.solution: Free space in /tmp or set TMPDIR to writable location
